0:
------------------------------------------------
Text: The Treaty of Addis Ababa, signed 23 October 1896, formally ended the First Italo–Ethiopian War on terms mostly favorable to Ethiopia.
Triplets:<The Treaty of Addis Ababa
1:
--------------------
Text: Treaty of Addis Ababa:  This treaty superseded a secret agreement between Ethiopia and Italy negotiated days after the decisive Battle of Adwa in March of the same year, in which Ethiopian forces commanded by Menelik II defeated the Italians.
Triplets:<Treaty of Addis Ababa
2:
--------------------
Text: Treaty of Addis Ababa:  The most important concession the Italians made was the abrogation of the Treaty of Wuchale and recognizing Ethiopia as an independent country.
Triplets:<Treaty of Addis Ababa
abrogation of the Treaty of Wuchale
recognizing Ethiopia as an independent country
